headline.main: Trump to Reverse Obama-Era Environmental Rules in Executive Orders: Report
headline.print_headline: Trump to Reverse Obama-Era Environmental Rules in Executive Orders: Report

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump will reverse a handful of Obama-era environmental regulations in executive orders that could be signed as early as this week, the Washington Post reported, citing unnamed sources with knowledge of the orders.

headline.main: Obama Made Kenyan Artist's Name, but Trump Portraits Fizzle
headline.print_headline: Obama Made Kenyan Artist's Name, but Trump Portraits Fizzle

docs.lead_paragraph: Kenyan artist Evans Yegon is sad to see President Barack Obama leave office. The artist has made a name for himself painting $1,000 portraits of Obama and he's finding the new focus of his work — Donald Trump — a hard sell.

headline.main: Obama Says U.N. Vote Didn't Rupture U.S.-Israel Relations
headline.print_headline: Obama Says U.N. Vote Didn't Rupture U.S.-Israel Relations

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama played down fallout from a U.S. abstention on a United Nations resolution last month demanding an end to Israeli settlements in occupied territory, saying it did not trigger a significant break in relations with Israel.

headline.main: King Day Highlights Transition From Obama to Trump
headline.print_headline: King Day Highlights Transition From Obama to Trump

docs.lead_paragraph: As Americans celebrate the legacy of Martin Luther King Jr., civil rights leaders and activists are trying to reconcile the transition from the nation's first black president to a president-elect still struggling to connect with most non-white voters.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 22 about a U.S. registration system for Muslim immigrants, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Kansas Secretary of State Kris Kobach met President-elect Donald Trump in New York last month. Kobach and Trump met in Bedminster, N.J.

headline.main: Arizona Advocates Buoyed by Obama Monument Action
headline.print_headline: Arizona Advocates Buoyed by Obama Monument Action

docs.lead_paragraph: Advocates for the creation of a national monument covering areas around Arizona's Grand Canyon National Park say they are hopeful after President Barack Obama created new monuments this week in Utah and Nevada, but Arizona's governor is threatening legal action if he acts.
